Description: unique DIGITbrain reference
human readable short, yet descriptive name of the Microservice
name of the authoring entity
creation date
version

Example Value: This microservices solves a certain problem using very specific methods. It supports some special input types, and allows results to be presented in chosen format.
Description: human readable short description of the Microservice's capabilities, e.g. which problems could be solved with it
fine-granular classification of the Microservice

Example Value: {neural network, deep learning, convolutional neural network, CNN}
Description: detailed type of the microservice, list of keywords
identifier of the deployment environment required to deploy the Microservice's container
JSON of docker-compose or kubernetes manifest required to run the container
configuration file(s) required by the service
directories shared on the host where this microservice can find required inputs
directories shared on the host where this microservice can find required outputs
recommended number of GPUs
minimum required number of GPUs
recommended amount of GPU memory in GB
minimum required amount of GPU memory in GB
a description of the type of GPUs, and further specifications, to allow the execution of the Microservice
whether this Microservice requires an HPC environment to be executed efficiently

Type: Enumeration {TPU (Google), NPU (Qualcomm), FPGA, NVIDIA Jetson AGX}
Description: required type of edge device to allow the execution of the Microservice
recommended amount of memory in GB
minimum required amount memory in GB
recommended number of CPU cores
minimum required number of CPU cores
required amount of disk space in GB
supported os architecture
supported os type
supported os distribution
description of supported os version
list of Data objects for each required input, specified using the "DATA" fields listed below
human-readable identifier, unique within a Microservice
supported types of the data resource (e.g. file/object storage, database management system, streaming broker). FILE can mean a single file or a folder.
supported direction of data flow (source: data provider, sink: data consumer/storage)

supported format/encoding of the data produced or consumed by the data resource as a MIME type (IETF RFC 6838 https://www.sitepoint.com/mime-types-complete-list/). More than one can appear here (remote directory with several files).
supported exact type of the data resource. Typically corresponds to the scheme part (protocol://) of DATA_URI
supported protocols
supported authentication type
supported MYSQL dialect
supported MQTT protocol version
supported Kafka broker version
supported S3 region

supported internal message structure, semantics, ontology.
It can be any file (doc, rdf, owl, etc.). Asset Administration Shell, IEC 61360 - Common Data Dictionary, …
list of Data objects for each generated output, specified using the "DATA" fields listed below
human-readable identifier, unique within a Microservice
supported types of the data resource (e.g. file/object storage, database management system, streaming broker). FILE can mean a single file or a folder.
supported direction of data flow (source: data provider, sink: data consumer/storage)

supported format/encoding of the data produced or consumed by the data resource as a MIME type (IETF RFC 6838 https://www.sitepoint.com/mime-types-complete-list/). More than one can appear here (remote directory with several files)
supported exact type of the data resource. Typically corresponds to the scheme part (protocol://) of DATA_URI.
supported protocols
supported authentication type
supported MYSQL dialect, for each generated output
supported MQTT protocol version
supported Kafka broker version
supported S3 region

supported internal message structure, semantics, ontology.
It can be any file (doc, rdf, owl, etc.). Asset Administration Shell, IEC 61360 - Common Data Dictionary, …
list of supported Model types
list of recommended AuthoringTools used to generate the Model
list of Parameter objects for each possible parameters, to be specified before deployment
short name for this parameter (should be unique across the Microservice’s parameters)
expected input type (may be used to verify the input)
whether this parameter is mandatory (default: false)
a default value, if the parameter is required but not provided

Example Value: This parameter can be used to configure the included algorithm in a certain way, possible values: "A", "B", "Z"
Description: short description of the parameter and its possible values
list of Metric objects for each metric collected by the Microservice
short name (should be unique across the Microservice's metrics)
identification of the corresponding measurement, i.e. output of the Model
short description of the mathematical approach used to derive this value
the unit of the metric measurement

Example Value: This metric describes the arithmetic mean of the approximated temperatures of the fabricated part when it leaves station 4.
Description: short description of the metric measurement
